author: Josh Zumbrun
title: Trade Consensus Eludes G-20 Meeting, As Ministers Focus on U.S. Tariffs
text:
BUENOS AIRES—Finance ministers and central bankers from the Group of 20 countries failed to reach a new agreement on trade, amid a deepening split between the U.S. and other major economies over Washington’s plans to impose tariffs on steel and aluminum.

G-20 summits revolve around writing a communiqué of shared principles on major economic policies. But after two days of negotiations, the closing statement released here Tuesday said G-20 officials “recognize the need for further dialogue and actions” on trade and they reaffirmed...
